member.name: StringFormat.Clone
member.summary: The StringFormat.Clone method creates a newStringFormat object and initializes it with the contents of thisStringFormat object.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the newStringFormat object.

member.name: StringFormat.GenericDefault
member.summary: The StringFormat.GenericDefault method creates a generic, defaultStringFormat object.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the newStringFormat object.

member.name: StringFormat.GenericTypographic
member.summary: The StringFormat.GenericTypographic method creates a generic, typographicStringFormat object.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the newStringFormat object.

member.name: StringFormat.GetAlignment
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetAlignment method gets an element of the enumeration that indicates the character alignment of thisStringFormat object in relation to the origin of the layout rectangle. A layout rectangle is used to position the displayed string.
member.returns: This method returns an element of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.GetDigitSubstitutionLanguage
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetDigitSubstitutionLanguage method gets the language that corresponds with the digits that are to be substituted for Western European digits.
member.returns: This method returns a 16-bit value that forms a National Language Support (NLS) language identifier. This identifier indicates the language that corresponds with the substitution digits. For example, if thisStringFormat object uses Arabic substitution digits, then this method will return a value that indicates an Arabic language. An NLS language identifier is constructed by the MAKELANGID macro declared in Winnt.h.

member.name: StringFormat.GetDigitSubstitutionMethod
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetDigitSubstitutionMethod method gets an element of the enumeration that indicates the digit substitution method that is used by thisStringFormat object.
member.returns: This method returns an element of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.GetFormatFlags
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetFormatFlags method gets the string format flags for thisStringFormat object.
member.returns: This method returns a value that indicates which string format flags are set for thisStringFormat object. This value can be any combination (the result of a bitwiseOR applied to two or more elements) of elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.GetHotkeyPrefix
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetHotkeyPrefix method gets an element of the enumeration that indicates the type of processing that is performed on a string when a hot key prefix, an ampersand (&), is encountered.
member.returns: This method returns an element of the enumeration that indicates the type of hot key prefix processing that is performed on a string.

member.name: StringFormat.GetLastStatus
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetLastStatus method returns a value that indicates the nature of thisStringFormat object's most recent method failure.

returns.para: The StringFormat.GetLastStatus method returns an element of the enumeration.
If no methods invoked on thisStringFormat object have failed since the previous call to StringFormat.GetLastStatus, then StringFormat.GetLastStatus returns Ok.

If at least one method invoked on thisStringFormat object has failed since the previous call to StringFormat.GetLastStatus, then StringFormat.GetLastStatus returns a value that indicates the nature of the most recent failure.

member.name: StringFormat.GetLineAlignment
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetLineAlignment method gets an element of the enumeration that indicates the line alignment of thisStringFormat object in relation to the origin of the layout rectangle. The line alignment setting specifies how to align the string vertically in the layout rectangle. The layout rectangle is used to position the displayed string.
member.returns: This method returns an element of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.GetMeasurableCharacterRangeCount
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetMeasurableCharacterRangeCount method gets the number of measurable character ranges that are currently set. The character ranges that are set can be measured in a string by using the method.
member.returns: This method returns an integer that indicates the number of character ranges that can be measured by .

member.name: StringFormat.GetTabStopCount
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetTabStopCount method gets the number of tab-stop offsets in thisStringFormat object.
member.returns: This method returns an integer that indicates the number of tab stops in thisStringFormat object.

member.name: StringFormat.GetTabStops
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetTabStops method gets the offsets of the tab stops in thisStringFormat object.
member.param: Integer that specifies the number of tab-stop offsets in thetabStops array.

Pointer to aREAL that receives the initial offset position. This initial offset position is relative to the string's origin and the offset of the first tab stop is relative to the initial offset position.

Pointer to an array of typeREAL that receives the tab-stop offsets. The offset of the first tab stop is the first value in the array, the offset of the second tab stop, the second value in the array, and so on.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.GetTrimming
member.summary: The StringFormat.GetTrimming method gets an element of the enumeration that indicates the trimming style of thisStringFormat object. The trimming style determines how to trim characters from a string that is too large to fit in the layout rectangle.
member.returns: This method returns an element of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetAlignment
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetAlignment method sets the character alignment of thisStringFormat object in relation to the origin of the layout rectangle. A layout rectangle is used to position the displayed string.
member.param: Element of the enumeration that specifies how a string is aligned in reference to the bounding rectangle.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetDigitSubstitution
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetDigitSubstitution method sets the digit substitution method and the language that corresponds to the digit substitutes.
member.param: Sixteen-bit value that forms a NLS language identifier. The identifier specifies the language associated with the substitute digits. For example, if thisStringFormat object uses Arabic substitution digits, then this method will return a value that indicates an Arabic language. An NLS language identifier is constructed by the MAKELANGID macro, declared in Winnt.h.
Element of the enumeration that specifies the digit substitution method to be used.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetFormatFlags
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetFormatFlags method sets the format flags for thisStringFormat object. The format flags determine most of the characteristics of aStringFormat object.
member.param: Thirty-two bit value that specifies the format flags that control most of the characteristics of theStringFormat object. The flags are set by applying a bitwiseOR to elements of the enumeration.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetHotkeyPrefix
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetHotkeyPrefix method sets the type of processing that is performed on a string when the hot key prefix, an ampersand (&), is encountered. The ampersand is called the hot key prefix and can be used to designate certain keys as hot keys.
member.param: Element of the enumeration that specifies how to process the hot key prefix.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetLineAlignment
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetLineAlignment method sets the line alignment of thisStringFormat object in relation to the origin of the layout rectangle. The line alignment setting specifies how to align the string vertically in the layout rectangle. The layout rectangle is used to position the displayed string.
member.param: Element of the enumeration that specifies how to align a string in reference to the layout rectangle.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetMeasurableCharacterRanges
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetMeasurableCharacterRanges method sets a series of character ranges for thisStringFormat object that, when in a string, can be measured by the method.
member.param: Integer that specifies the number of character ranges in theranges array.
Pointer to an array ofCharacterRange objects that specify the character ranges to be measured.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetTabStops
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetTabStops method sets the offsets for tab stops in thisStringFormat object.
member.param: Real number that specifies the initial offset position. This initial offset position is relative to the string's origin and the offset of the first tab stop is relative to the initial offset position.
Integer that specifies the number of tab-stop offsets in thetabStops array.

Pointer to an array of real numbers that specify the tab-stop offsets. The offset of the first tab stop is the first value in the array, the offset of the second tab stop, the second value in the array, and so on.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.SetTrimming
member.summary: The StringFormat.SetTrimming method sets the trimming style for thisStringFormat object. The trimming style determines how to trim a string so that it fits into the layout rectangle.
member.param: Element of the enumeration that specifies the style of trimming to be performed on the string.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: StringFormat.StringFormat
member.summary: Creates a StringFormat object from another StringFormat object.
member.param: Pointer to a StringFormat object to copy.

member.name: StringFormat.StringFormat
member.summary: Creates a StringFormat object based on string format flags and a language.
member.param: Optional. Value that specifies the format flags that control most of the characteristics of the StringFormat object. The flags are set by applying a bitwiseOR to elements of the enumeration. The default value is 0 (no flags set).
Optional. Sixteen-bit value that specifies the language to use. The default value is LANG_NEUTRAL, which is the user's default language.
